section.title: Loot Tab
section.para: This tab tracks loot and gold that your character has aquired. The tab is divided into several tables that group loot by quality. The tables are sorted by the quantity of the item looted, and then alphabetically.

tip.para: When you move your mouse over an item, a tooltip will appear, similar to the in-game tooltip, to give you more details.
Clicking on an item will open your web browser to the page specified in your WoW DB Site setting.

section.para: On the top part of the tab, "Gold Looted" indicates the amount of actual coin that you have looted. "Loot Worth" is the calculated worth of all the items you looted if you were to sell them to a vendor. "Gold/Hour" calculates the rate at which you are making gold by adding "Gold Looted" and "Loot Worth" and dividing that by the amount of time that JGlideMon has been tracking your loot.

JGlideMon retrieves the information about items from Allakhazam. If Allakhazam cannot be contacted, then JGlideMon cannot determine an item's quality or icon. In this case, the item will appear in the "Poor" quality table with the question mark icon.

tip.para: JGlideMon caches this information the first time it retrieves it so that it is not connecting to Allakhazam every single time you loot something. If you are experiencing problems, you can try deleting the cache files, icons.cache and items.cache, after you have shut down JGlideMon.
